special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
This update uses a new upstream release, which includes additional
bug fixes. After a standard system update you need to restart any
Java applications or applets to make all the necessary changes.
threat: An attacker could create a Java application or applet that used these flaws to bypass Java sandbox restrictions or modify immutable object data.
A attacker could specially craft a font file that could cause a denial of service through crashing the JVM (Java Virtual Machine) or possibly execute arbitrary code.
An attacker could create a Java application or applet that used this flaw to cause a denial of service through crashing the JVM or bypass Java sandbox restrictions.
A local attacker could use this to gain access to sensitive information.
A remote attacker could use this to gain access to sensitive information.
A remote attacker could create a Java application or applet that used this to cause a denial of service through crashing the JVM or bypass Java sandbox restrictions.
An attacker could create an XML document that caused a denial of service in a Java application or applet parsing the document.
